name: Kiddie Cartoons Quiz / Test | Assorted TV Trivia for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: The life of a puppy is examined.
questions.explanation:
Clifford's Puppy Days.

	'Clifford's Puppy Days' will examine Clifford, the big red dog as a puppy. Clifford's voice is done by John Ritter.

questions.text: A video game star is sent to another planet to battle an evil doctor.
questions.explanation:
Sonic X.

	'Sonic X' will battle an evil doctor named Eggman with a boy named Christopher.

questions.text: A teen Shaman team joins up with an ancient warrior to fight evil spirts.
questions.explanation:
Shaman King.

	'Shaman King' is a Japanese cartoon.

questions.text: 'Connie the Cow' is a cartoon that stars a nosey cow?
questions.explanation:
True.

	'Connie the Cow' is done in 'Blue's Clues' fashion and will have three stories per episode. The cartoon is pictured in watercolor style.

questions.text: A young singer and his single father go through life together.
questions.explanation:
Romeo!.

	'Romeo!' stars hip-hop artist Lil' Romeo and his father Master P.

questions.text: A young clown lives in the circus with her father who gets shot out of a cannon as a living.
questions.explanation:
JoJo's Circus.

	'JoJo's Circus' will be interactive in that JoJo will have the kids up dancing and talking to her.

questions.text: An alien and his owner track down the alien's six-hundred and twenty-five cousins in each episode.
questions.explanation:
Lilo and Stitch: The Series.

	'Lilo and Stitch: The Series' is a cartoon based on the Disney hit 'Lilo and Stitch'.

questions.text: A ten-year old girl brings home an eight hundred pound friend to live with her.
questions.explanation:
Kenny the Shark.

	'Kenny the Shark' is the second animated show the Discovery channel has put on the network.

questions.text: This cartoon series takes up where a real movie left off.
questions.explanation:
Star Wars: Clone Wars.

	'Star Wars: Clone Wars' will take up where 'Star Wars II: Attack of the Clones' left off.

Xiaolin Showdown.

	'Xiaolin Showdown' was inspired by its creator Christy Shuk Hui's coming from China to the United States as a kung-fu obsessed teen. The August 23-29 issue of 'TV Guide' was my resource for this quiz.
